reference.unstructured: In the Katsuki paper (ref. 10) the configuration of epoxide obtained from 4 with the use of (-)-diisopropyl tartrate is assigned erroneously as (2S,3S) [should be (2R,3R)]
Signals of the other enantiomer were not detectable in the spectra (comparison was made to the product derived from racemic material)
Upon the use of MeOH as solvent in the hydrolysis, according to the original procedure,8the product was contaminated with methyl pnitrobenzoate which was difficult to remove.
